docs.title: About JoinMusic
docs.text: JoinMusic is a powerful Bukkit/Spigot plugin that enhances your server's atmosphere by playing music when players join. It supports both standalone Spigot servers and BungeeCord networks, offering a seamless musical experience for your players.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• 🎵 Automatic music playback on player join
  • 🌐 BungeeCord network support
  • ⚙️ Highly configurable settings
  • 🌍 World-specific music playback
  • 🔄 Optional music looping
  • 📊 PlaceholderAPI integration
  • 🔔 Automatic update notifications

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Bukkit/Spigot 1.8 - 1.21
  • NoteBlockAPI (Version 1.6.1.1 or newer)
  • PlaceholderAPI (optional)

docs.title: Commands
docs.text: JoinMusic provides several commands to control music playback and plugin settings. All commands can be used with either /joinmusic or the shorter alias /jm.

docs.title: Command Overview
docs.text: Command Description Permission /joinmusic or /jm Shows help with available commands JoinMusic.use /joinmusic reload Reloads the configuration JoinMusic.command.reload /joinmusic stop Stops the currently playing music JoinMusic.command.stop /joinmusic disable Disables automatic music playback JoinMusic.command.disableOwn /joinmusic enable Enables automatic music playback JoinMusic.command.disableOwn

docs.title: Main Command
docs.text:
/joinmusic
/jm
Shows the help menu with all available commands and their descriptions.

Permission: JoinMusic.use

docs.title: Reload Command
docs.text:
/joinmusic reload
/jm reload
Reloads the plugin configuration from the config.yml file. This is useful after making changes to the configuration without restarting the server.

Permission: JoinMusic.command.reload

Example: 

> /jm reload
[JoinMusic] The reload was successful!

docs.title: Stop Command
docs.text:
/joinmusic stop
/jm stop
Stops the currently playing music. This is useful if you want to stop the music before it finishes playing.

Permission: JoinMusic.command.stop

Example: 

> /jm stop
[JoinMusic] Stopped playing the song! You can disable playing a song on join with /jm disable

docs.title: Disable Command
docs.text:
/joinmusic disable
/jm disable
Disables automatic music playback when joining the server. This setting is saved per player.

Permission: JoinMusic.command.disableOwn

Example: 

> /jm disable
[JoinMusic] Disabled playing a song when joining. To enable it again, use /jm enable

docs.title: Enable Command
docs.text:
/joinmusic enable
/jm enable
Enables automatic music playback when joining the server. This setting is saved per player.

Permission: JoinMusic.command.disableOwn

Example: 

> /jm enable
[JoinMusic] Enabled playing a song when joining

docs.title: Toggle Command
docs.text:
/joinmusic toggle
/jm toggle
Toggles (enables or disables) automatic music playback when joining the server. This setting is saved per player.

Permission: JoinMusic.command.disableOwn

Example: 

> /jm toggle
[JoinMusic] Disabled playing a song when joining. To enable it again, use /jm enable


> /jm toggle
[JoinMusic] Enabled playing a song when joining

docs.title: Command Messages
docs.text:
All command messages can be customized in the config.yml file under the messages section:

messages:
  prefix: "&7[&bJoinMusic&7]"
  reload: "&3The reload was successful!"
  stop: "&3Stopped playing the song! &7&oYou can disable playing a song on join with &b&o/jm disable"
  no-permission: "&cYou don't have enough permissions"
  disabled: "&3Disabled playing a song when joining. To enable it again, use &b/jm enable"
  enabled: "&3Enabled playing a song when joining"
  playing: "&2Started Playing the Song: &a&l%song%&2. You can stop it using &a/jm stop"
  help:
    stop: "Stop playing the Song!"
    disableOwn: "Disable playing a song when joining"
    enableOwn: "Enable playing a song when joining"

docs.title: Tab Completion
docs.text: JoinMusic supports tab completion for all commands, making it easier to use the commands without remembering the exact syntax.

docs.title: Command Aliases
docs.text: For convenience, all commands can be used with either the full command name /joinmusic or the shorter alias /jm.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: JoinMusic's configuration is stored in plugins/JoinMusic/config.yml. This guide explains all available configuration options.

docs.title: Main Configuration
docs.text:
# Main music file
music: Song.nbs

options:
  # Update settings
  update-check: true        # Checks for updates on server start
  updateinfo: true          # Shows update notifications for OPs

  # General settings
  metrics: true             # Sends anonymous usage statistics
  delaySong: 2              # Delay in seconds before playing
  bungeecord: false         # Enable/disable BungeeCord mode
  printSongTitel: true      # Shows the song title when playing
  allowDisabling: true      # Allows players to disable music for themselves

  # Music settings
  music:
    random: false           # Enable random music selection
    RandomFoldername: "random" # Folder for random music selection
    Mode: "MonoMode"        # Playback mode (MonoMode/StereoMode)
    10Octave: false         # Enable 10 octaves
    Volume: 100             # Volume (0-100)
    AllowLooping: false     # Play music in a loop
    OneWorldonly: false     # Play music only in a specific world
    Worldname: "world"      # Name of the world if OneWorldonly is enabled

# Message settings
messages:
  prefix: "&7[&bJoinMusic&7]"
  reload: "&3The reload was successful!"
  stop: "&3Stopped playing the song! &7&oYou can disable playing a song on join with &b&o/jm disable"
  no-permission: "&cYou don't have enough permissions"
  disabled: "&3Disabled playing a song when joining. To enable it again, use &b/jm enable"
  enabled: "&3Enabled playing a song when joining"
  playing: "&2Started Playing the Song: &a&l%song%&2. You can stop it using &a/jm stop"
  help:
    stop: "Stop playing the Song!"
    disableOwn: "Disable playing a song when joining"
    enableOwn: "Enable playing a song when joining"

docs.title: Message Settings
docs.text:
All messages support color codes using the & symbol:

Message Description Default messages.prefix Command prefix &7[&bJoinMusic&7] messages.reload Reload success &3The reload was successful! messages.stop Stop message &3Stopped playing the song! messages.no-permission Permission denied &cYou don't have enough permissions messages.disabled Music disabled &3Disabled playing a song when joining messages.enabled Music enabled &3Enabled playing a song when joining messages.playing Song playing &2Started Playing the Song: &a&l%song%

docs.title: Color Codes
docs.text:
You can use these color codes in messages: - &0 - Black - &1 - Dark Blue - &2 - Dark Green - &3 - Dark Aqua - &4 - Dark Red - &5 - Dark Purple - &6 - Gold - &7 - Gray - &8 - Dark Gray - &9 - Blue - &a - Green - &b - Aqua - &c - Red - &d - Light Purple - &e - Yellow - &f - White

Formatting codes: - &l - Bold - &n - Underline - &o - Italic - &k - Magic - &r - Reset

docs.title: Reloading Configuration
docs.text: To apply configuration changes: 1. Edit the config.yml file 2. Use the command /joinmusic reload or /jm reload 3. The changes will be applied immediately

docs.title: Features
docs.text: JoinMusic comes packed with many features to enhance your server's atmosphere. Here's a detailed overview of what the plugin offers.

docs.title: 🎵 Music Playback
docs.text:
• Automatic music playback when players join the server
  • Support for both standalone Spigot servers and BungeeCord networks
  • Configurable delay before playing music
  • Optional music looping functionality

docs.title: 🌐 Network Support
docs.text:
• Full BungeeCord network compatibility
  • Seamless integration across multiple servers
  • Synchronized music playback across your network

docs.title: 🌍 World-Specific Music
docs.text:
• Play different music in different worlds
  • Configure specific music for each world
  • Option to restrict music to a single world

docs.title: ⚙️ Configuration Options
docs.text:
• Customizable delay settings
  • Volume control (0-100%)
  • Mono and Stereo playback modes
  • 10-octave support
  • Random music selection from folders

docs.title: 🔌 Integration Features
docs.text:
• PlaceholderAPI support
  • Automatic update notifications
  • Metrics collection (optional)
  • Player-specific music preferences

docs.title: 🎮 Player Control
docs.text:
• Players can disable music for themselves
  • Command to stop currently playing music
  • Individual player preferences saved

docs.title: 📊 Statistics and Monitoring
docs.text:
• bStats integration for usage statistics
  • Server and player count tracking
  • Performance monitoring

docs.title: 🔔 Notification System
docs.text:
• Song title announcements
  • Update notifications for server operators
  • Configurable message prefix

docs.title: 🛠️ Technical Features
docs.text:
• Support for Bukkit/Spigot 1.8 - 1.21
  • Efficient resource usage
  • Easy configuration through YAML files
  • Comprehensive permission system

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: This guide will help you install and set up JoinMusic on your server.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before installing JoinMusic, make sure you have:

  • A Bukkit/Spigot server (version 1.8 - 1.21)
  • NoteBlockAPI (Version 1.6.1.1 or newer)
  • PlaceholderAPI (optional)

docs.title: Step 1: Download Required Files
docs.text:
1. Download the latest version of JoinMusic from:
  2. Spigot
  3. Bukkit
  4. Hangar

  5. Modrinth

  6. Download NoteBlockAPI

docs.title: Step 2: Install the Plugins
docs.text:
1. Stop your server
  2. Place both JAR files in your server's plugins folder:
  3. JoinMusic.jar
  4. NoteBlockAPI.jar
  5. Start your server

docs.title: Step 3: Initial Configuration
docs.text:
1. The plugin will generate its configuration file on first run
  2. Place your music files (.nbs format) in the plugins/JoinMusic/music folder
  3. Configure the plugin using the commands or by editing plugins/JoinMusic/config.yml

docs.title: BungeeCord Setup
docs.text: If you're using a BungeeCord network, follow these additional steps:

docs.title: Step 1: Install on Spigot Servers
docs.text:
1. Install JoinMusic and NoteBlockAPI on all Spigot servers in your network
  2. Enable BungeeCord mode in the configuration of each Spigot server

docs.title: Step 2: Install on BungeeCord
docs.text:
1. Download the BungeeCord version of JoinMusic
  2. Place the BungeeCord plugin JAR in your BungeeCord's plugins folder
  3. Restart your BungeeCord server

docs.title: Verification
docs.text:
To verify your installation:

  1. Check the server console for any error messages
  2. Use the command /joinmusic or /jm to see if the plugin responds
  3. Join the server to test if music plays automatically

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
If you encounter issues:

  1. Check if NoteBlockAPI is properly installed
  2. Verify your music files are in the correct format (.nbs)
  3. Ensure you have the correct permissions
  4. Check the server logs for error messages

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: After installation: - Configure the plugin - Set up permissions - Learn about available commands

docs.title: Permissions
docs.text: JoinMusic uses a comprehensive permission system to control access to commands and features. This page lists all available permissions and their purposes.

docs.title: Permission Overview
docs.text: Permission Description Default JoinMusic.use Allows using the /joinmusic command All players JoinMusic.play Allows using /joinmusic play All players JoinMusic.command.stop Allows using /joinmusic stop All players JoinMusic.command.reload Allows using /joinmusic reload Operators JoinMusic.command.disableOwn Allows using /joinmusic disable and /jm enable All players JoinMusic.update Receives update notifications Operators

docs.title: JoinMusic.use
docs.text:
• Description: Allows using the main /joinmusic command
  • Default: All players
  • Usage: This permission is required to use any JoinMusic command
  • Example: Without this permission, players cannot see the help menu

docs.title: JoinMusic.play
docs.text:
• Description: Allows using the /joinmusic play command
  • Default: All players
  • Usage: This permission is required to manually play music
  • Example: Players with this permission can trigger music playback

docs.title: JoinMusic.command.stop
docs.text:
• Description: Allows using the /joinmusic stop command
  • Default: All players
  • Usage: This permission is required to stop currently playing music
  • Example: Players with this permission can stop music that is currently playing

docs.title: JoinMusic.command.reload
docs.text:
• Description: Allows using the /joinmusic reload command
  • Default: Operators
  • Usage: This permission is required to reload the plugin configuration
  • Example: Server administrators use this to apply configuration changes without restarting

docs.title: JoinMusic.command.disableOwn
docs.text:
• Description: Allows using /joinmusic disable and /jm enable commands
  • Default: All players
  • Usage: This permission is required to toggle music playback for yourself
  • Example: Players with this permission can disable music when they join

docs.title: JoinMusic.update
docs.text:
• Description: Receives update notifications
  • Default: Operators
  • Usage: This permission is required to see update notifications
  • Example: Server administrators use this to be informed about new versions

docs.title: Permission Configuration
docs.text:
JoinMusic integrates with popular permission plugins such as:

  • LuckPerms
  • PermissionsEx
  • GroupManager
  • EssentialsX

To set up permissions, you can use your preferred permission plugin's commands or configuration files.

docs.title: Example with LuckPerms
docs.text:
/lp user <player> permission set JoinMusic.command.reload
/lp group admin permission set JoinMusic.command.reload

docs.title: Example with PermissionsEx
docs.text:
/pex user <player> add JoinMusic.command.reload
/pex group admin add JoinMusic.command.reload

docs.title: Default Permission Assignments
docs.text:
By default, JoinMusic assigns permissions as follows:

  • All players can use basic commands (JoinMusic.use, JoinMusic.play, JoinMusic.command.stop, JoinMusic.command.disableOwn)
  • Only operators can use administrative commands (JoinMusic.command.reload, JoinMusic.update)

docs.title: Permission Inheritance
docs.text:
If you're using a permission plugin that supports inheritance, you can set up permission groups to inherit permissions from other groups. For example:

admin:
  permissions:
    - JoinMusic.*
moderator:
  permissions:
    - JoinMusic.use
    - JoinMusic.play
    - JoinMusic.command.stop
player:
  permissions:
    - JoinMusic.use
    - JoinMusic.command.disableOwn

This way, administrators would have all permissions, moderators would have most permissions except reload, and regular players would only have basic permissions.

docs.title: Statistics
docs.text: JoinMusic uses bStats to collect anonymous usage statistics. This helps us understand how the plugin is being used and what features are most popular.

docs.title: Detailed Statistics
docs.text: You can view detailed statistics about JoinMusic on the bStats website.

docs.title: Privacy Note
docs.text: bStats collects anonymous usage data only. No personal information is collected or stored. You can disable metrics in the configuration file by setting options.metrics to false.
